translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In the order of the True Idea, in the reverse order of the True Idea, and in the Triad of the Paṭṭhāna Text

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.46. Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaduka, Kusalattika🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno naakusalo
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna duka kusala ttika  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam kusalam dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ na akusalaḥ
translated: The pair of profitable and unprofitable ideas produced by cognizance associated with the mind, and the triad of profitable ideas

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Abyākatamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva paccayavasena.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi abyākata mūlam tīṇi yeva paccaya vasena
translated: With a profitable idea produced by cognizance associated with the mind as condition there arises a non-cognizance-originated unprofitable idea, a root-cause condition.
